Question:
In an experiment, a ball is rolled down a curved track that is about half a metre long.
Which measuring device is used to measure the length accurately?
Which row describes acceleration, displacement, distance and speed?
What is the size of the resultant of the two forces shown?

The curved line on the distance-time graph shows the motion of a toy car.
The straight line is the tangent to the curve at 10 s.
What is the speed of the toy car at 10 s?

The diagrams show four balances, W, X, Y and Z.
The scales of all the balances are calibrated on the Earth to measure mass.
Which balances also measure mass correctly when used on the Moon?

A spacecraft carries a probe to Mars where the gravitational field strength is 3.7 N / kg.
The weight of the probe on Mars is 370 N.
The gravitational field strength on Earth is 9.8 N / kg.
What are the mass and the weight of the probe on Earth?

A student determines the density of a liquid.
Which equipment does the student use?

Options.B: a balance and a measuring cylinder
Options.C: a beaker and a measuring cylinder

Question:
Newton's third law describes a pair of forces.
Which row shows whether the two forces are of the same type and whether they act on the same object?

The stopping distance of a car is the sum of the thinking distance and the braking distance.
Which factors affect the braking distance?

Options.D: speed of car, condition of road

Question:
A load-extension graph for a spring is shown.
Which point is the limit of proportionality for the spring and what is the spring constant of the spring equal to?

A uniform beam is pivoted at its midpoint.
An object weighing 40 N is placed on the beam 20 cm to the left of the pivot as shown.
Which force and position balances the system?

Options.A: 20 N acting downwards, 40 cm to the right of the pivot
Options.B: 20 N acting upwards, 40 cm to the right of the pivot
Options.C: 50 N acting downwards, 10 cm to the left of the pivot
Options.D: 50 N acting upwards, 10 cm to the left of the pivot

Question:
A worker pulls a rope with a force P through a distance d in the direction of the force as shown.
This causes a block of weight W to move vertically upwards through a height h.
How much work is done by the worker?

A battery is connected in a circuit to light a lamp.
What is the energy store in the battery?
What is a property of both liquids and gases?

Options.D: They have particles in fixed positions.

Question:
In an experiment, the volume of a gas in a cylinder is measured as the pressure of the gas is increased.
The values obtained are shown.
What is a possible explanation for these results?

Options.A: After the pressure is doubled, gas starts leaking into the cylinder.
Options.B: After the pressure is doubled, gas starts leaking out of the cylinder.
Options.C: The temperature of the gas is constant.
Options.D: The temperature of the gas is increasing.

Question:
The diagrams show examples of thermal expansion.
In which diagrams is the thermal expansion useful?
Which statement about copper explains why it is a better thermal conductor than glass?

Options.A: Atomic vibration is passed on to neighbouring copper atoms slowly.
Options.B: Atoms move through the copper and pass on kinetic energy.
Options.C: There are density changes within the copper.
Options.D: There are free electrons in the copper.

Question: Which statement describes the transfer of thermal energy in a liquid by convection?

Options.A: A decrease in its density causes the heated liquid to rise.
Options.B: Free electrons carry energy large distances through the liquid.
Options.C: Infrared radiation passes through the liquid and transfers energy.
Options.D: Particles of the liquid vibrate and pass energy to neighbouring particles.

Question: Which characteristics describe the image formed by a vertical plane mirror?

Options.C: real and larger than the object
Options.D: virtual and smaller than the object

Question: A ray of light passes into a block of transparent material as shown.

The diagrams show light incident on the straight edge of a semi-circular glass block after passing
through it.
Which diagram shows refraction and an angle i equal to the critical angle of the glass?
Which radioactive isotope can be used for measuring cracks or flaws in metal components?

Options.A: americium-241, an alpha emitter with a half-life of 432 years
Options.B: cobalt-60, a gamma emitter with a half-life of 5 years
Options.C: radium-223, an alpha emitter with a half-life of 11 days
Options.D: barium-137, a gamma emitter with a half-life of 3 minutes

Question:
Ultrasound is a type of sound wave that is not audible to a healthy human ear.
Which range of frequencies contains only ultrasound?
What proves that a metal bar is a permanent magnet?

Options.A: It attracts both ends of a compass needle.
Options.B: It attracts one end of another magnet.
Options.D: It repels one end of another magnet.

Question:
The diagram shows a bar magnet and four labelled arrows.
Which arrow shows the direction of the magnetic field at the point where the arrow is shown?

A shoe becomes positively charged by friction when it rubs against a carpet.
What happens as the shoe becomes charged?

Options.A: Negative electrons are transferred to the carpet.
Options.B: Negative electrons are transferred to the shoe.
Options.C: Positive electrons are transferred to the carpet.
Options.D: Positive electrons are transferred to the shoe.

Question:
A metal conductor is connected between the positive and negative terminals of a battery.
Which row gives the direction of movement of the particles that flow in the conductor and their
name?

Options.A:
from positive terminal to negative terminal
protons
Options.B:
from positive terminal to negative terminal
electrons
Options.C:
from negative terminal to positive terminal
protons
Options.D:
from negative terminal to positive terminal
electrons

Question:
Three identical cells are connected in parallel to a resistor.
What is the advantage of using three cells in parallel rather than using a single cell?

Options.C: Each cell takes longer to discharge.
Options.D: The e.m.f. is greater than that of a single cell.

Question:
A student has three 15 Ω resistors.
She connects the resistors together in different arrangements.
What is the minimum resistance and what is the maximum resistance of the arrangements that
the student can produce?

The circuit diagram shows a variable resistor R connected in parallel to the lower section of a
potential divider.
The resistance of R increases.
What happens to the two voltmeter readings V1 and V2?

The power consumption of a microwave oven is 1500 W.
The cost of 1.0 kW h of electrical energy is 24 cents.
What is the cost of using the microwave oven for 10 minutes?

A coil of wire above a magnet is dropped. As the coil falls over the magnet, an e.m.f. is induced
across the coil.
What does not affect the magnitude of the e.m.f. induced across the coil?

Options.A: changing the number of turns of wire in the coil
Options.B: changing the height h from which the coil is dropped
Options.C: changing the direction of the magnet, so the north pole is at the bottom
Options.D: changing the strength of the magnetic field from the magnet

Question: The results of the alpha-particle scattering experiment give evidence for which of the following?

A nucleus of an isotope of cobalt is represented by the symbol Co.59
27
What is the composition of this nucleus?
Topic: 5.1 The Nuclear Model of the Atom

Question:
The only stable isotope of gold, Au, has 79 protons and 118 neutrons in a nucleus of an atom.
How many electrons are there in a neutral atom of this isotope?
Topic: 5.1 The Nuclear Model of the Atom

Question:
A sample of a radioactive isotope with a very long half-life is placed next to a detector. Sheets of different materials are inserted, one at a time, between the radioactive sample and the detector. The background count rate is subtracted from the readings on the detector and the corrected count rates are recorded in the table.

type of material corrected count rate
counts / s

no sheet inserted 450

thin aluminium sheet 381

thin lead sheet 285

thin paper sheet 452

Which types of radiation are emitted by the radioactive sample?
In a fission reactor, which particle causes a uranium-235 nucleus to split?

What is the purpose of moderators in nuclear reactors?

A to absorb all the neutrons in order to stop the chain reaction

B to produce more neutrons in order to create a chain reaction

C to remove thermal energy in order to control the chain reaction

D to slow down neutrons in order to continue the chain reaction

Options.A: to absorb all the neutrons in order to stop the chain reaction
Options.B: to produce more neutrons in order to create a chain reaction
Options.C: to remove thermal energy in order to control the chain reaction
Options.D: to slow down neutrons in order to continue the chain reaction

Question: In which region of the electromagnetic spectrum does the Sun radiate the most energy?

Four of the stages in the life cycle of a star, until it becomes a red giant, are shown.

W Inward force of gravitational attraction is balanced by an outward force from its
centre.

X Internal gravitational collapse produces an increase in temperature.

Y It expands.

Z Most of the hydrogen has been converted to helium.

In which order do these stages occur, starting with the earliest?
